documentation.text:
@dev The Liquidations contract allows to liquidate undercollateralized weth vaults in a reverse Dutch auction.
 Undercollateralized vaults can be liquidated by calling `liquidate`.
 Collateral from vaults can be bought with Dai using `buy`.
 Debt and collateral records will be adjusted in the Controller using `controller.grab`.
 Dai taken in payment will be handed over to Treasury, and collateral assets bought will be taken from Treasury as well.
 If a vault becomes colalteralized, the liquidation can be stopped with `cancel`.
@dev The Liquidations constructor links it to the Treasury and Controller contracts.
@dev Only while Liquidations is not unwinding due to a MakerDAO shutdown.
@dev Overflow-protected addition, from OpenZeppelin
@dev Overflow-protected substraction, from OpenZeppelin
@dev Safe casting from uint256 to uint128
@dev Disables buying at liquidations. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.

@dev Return if the debt of an user is between zero and the dust level
 @param user Address of the user vault

@dev Starts a liquidation process for an undercollateralized vault.
 @param user Address of the user vault to liquidate.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Liquidations: Vault is not in liquidation"

arguments.value: Liquidations: Vault is not in liquidation

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Liquidations: Vault is not in liquidation"

 @param user Address of the user vault in liquidation.

 Undercollateralized vaults can be liquidated by calling `liquidate`.
 Collateral from vaults can be bought with Dai using `buy`.
 Debt and collateral records will be adjusted in the Controller using `controller.grab`.
 Dai taken in payment will be handed over to Treasury, and collateral assets bought will be taken from Treasury as well.
 If a vault becomes colalteralized, the liquidation can be stopped with `cancel`.
@dev The Liquidations constructor links it to the Treasury and Controller contracts.
@dev Only while Liquidations is not unwinding due to a MakerDAO shutdown.
@dev Overflow-protected addition, from OpenZeppelin
@dev Overflow-protected substraction, from OpenZeppelin

 @param user Address of the user vault to liquidate.

documentation.text:
@dev Return price of a collateral unit, in dai, at the present moment, for a given user
 @param user Address of the user vault in liquidation.

devdoc.details: The Liquidations contract allows to liquidate undercollateralized weth vaults in a reverse Dutch auction. Undercollateralized vaults can be liquidated by calling `liquidate`. Collateral from vaults can be bought with Dai using `buy`. Debt and collateral records will be adjusted in the Controller using `controller.grab`. Dai taken in payment will be handed over to Treasury, and collateral assets bought will be taken from Treasury as well. If a vault becomes colalteralized, the liquidation can be stopped with `cancel`.

aboveDustOrZero(address).details: Return if the debt of an user is between zero and the dust level

addDelegate(address).details: Enable a delegate to act on the behalf of caller

addDelegateBySignature(address,address,u.details: Add a delegate through an encoded signature

batchOrchestrate(address,bytes4[]).details: Adds orchestration for the provided function signatures

buy(address,address,address,uint256).details: Buy a portion of a position under liquidation. The caller pays the debt of `user`, and `from` receives an amount of collateral. `from` can delegate to other addresses to buy for him. Also needs to use `ERC20.approve`.

params.daiAmount: Amount of Dai to give in exchange for liquidated collateral.
params.from: Address of the wallet paying Dai for liquidated collateral.
params.liquidated: Address of the user vault to liquidate.
params.to: Address of the wallet to send the obtained collateral to.

constructor.details: The Liquidations constructor links it to the Treasury and Controller contracts.

erase(address).details: Removes all collateral and debt for an user. This function can only be called by other Yield contracts, not users directly.

returns._0: The amounts of collateral and debt removed from Liquidations.

liquidate(address).details: Starts a liquidation process for an undercollateralized vault.

params.user: Address of the user vault to liquidate.

params.signature: bytes4 signature of the function we are giving orchestrated access to. It seems to me a bad idea to give access to humans, and would use this only for predictable smart contracts.
params.user: Address of user or contract having access to this contract.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

price(address).details: Return price of a collateral unit, in dai, at the present moment, for a given user

params.user: Address of the user vault in liquidation.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokeDelegate(address).details: Stop a delegate from acting on the behalf of caller

shutdown().details: Disables buying at liquidations. To be called only when Treasury shuts down.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(address,address,uint256).details: Retrieve weth from a liquidations account. This weth could be a remainder from liquidations. `from` can delegate to other addresses to withdraw from him.

params.from: Address of the liquidations user vault to withdraw weth from.
params.to: Address of the wallet receiving the withdrawn weth.
